author: Ben Leubsdorf
title: U.S. GDP Growth Revised Up to 2.9% Rate in Fourth Quarter
text:
WASHINGTONâ€”Economic growth was stronger during the final three months of 2017 than earlier estimated, but a key measure of U.S. corporate profits weakened against a backdrop of significant changes to the tax code.
Gross domestic product, a broad measure of the goods and services produced across the U.S., rose at a 2.9% annual rate in the fourth quarter, adjusted for seasonality and inflation, the Commerce Department said Wednesday.
